comments:
+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #178760 +++

Deleting files for EFS filesystems shows an error:
An internal error occurred during: "Checking resources".

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: 
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isLegal(Assert.java:62)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isLegal(Assert.java:46)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobManager.validateRule(JobManager.java:1167)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobManager.setRule(JobManager.java:1029)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.InternalJob.setRule(InternalJob.java:449)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.jobs.Job.setRule(Job.java:523)
	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.DeleteResourceAction.scheduleDeleteJob(DeleteResourceAction.java:623)
	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.DeleteResourceAction.access$1(DeleteResourceAction.java:589)
	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.DeleteResourceAction$2.run(DeleteResourceAction.java:562)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

Strange part is that I'm able to delete child of the main root node.
like the copy/paste thing this also works for me, both for local and remote files even when selecting multiple files. mateusz, could you please check again if this bug should still be open?

As I already said for the copy/paste bug (bug #178760) this should be solved if we mount your filesystems using IFolder.createLink() since then we don't have to differentiate between local and remote files anymore.
Besides the fact that we are going for the new approach this issue is fixed now for the current architecture
